creator: def@directcommerce.com
text:
If a class name has leading/trailing whitespace (i.e. in the JMeter 1.7beta
distribution's xml.parser property), the
org.apache.jmeter.util.JMeterUtils.instantiate(string,string) method will not
create the class.

Either call trim() on the parameters to instantiate, or ensure that the
properties don't have whitespace
*** Bug 4657 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: khammond25@home.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
